title: Finance Leaders
subtitle: accuracy, control, and transparency across financial execution

xMatixPlatform.title: For Finance Leaders
xMatixPlatform.description1: Finance leaders are responsible for financial accuracy, compliance, and cash flow, while supporting fast-moving operations. Execution breaks when finance systems are disconnected from sales, service, inventory, and payroll execution.
xMatixPlatform.description2: xMatix provides a single execution layer that connects financial operations directly to real work, enabling timely closes, reduced leakage, and real-time financial visibility.

ecosystemSection.title: The Problem
ecosystemSection.description: Most finance teams rely on ERP systems and spreadsheets that reflect outcomes after execution has already occurred. Disconnected operational systems create delays, manual reconciliation, and limited control over costs, revenue, and compliance during active operations.

ecosystem.title: ERP-Centric Finance Processes
ecosystem.description: Record financial transactions accurately but lack real-time connection to operational execution and exceptions.

ecosystem.title: Manual Reconciliation & Adjustments
ecosystem.description: Rely on spreadsheets and manual reviews to reconcile sales, service, inventory, and payroll data.

ecosystem.title: Delayed Financial Visibility
ecosystem.description: Provide lagging indicators on revenue, costs, and margins, limiting proactive financial control.

ecosystem.title: Compliance & Audit Pressure
ecosystem.description: Increase risk and effort due to fragmented data, inconsistent processes, and limited traceability.

whatIsIt.title: How xMatix Helps
whatIsIt.description2: xMatix acts as the execution layer that connects financial processes directly to operational workflows. Built on the xMatix Platform, Data Fabric, and Sense, it ensures that revenue, costs, incentives, and payroll are captured as execution happens, improving accuracy, control, and auditability without replacing core finance systems.

cardLayoutData.title: How {{highlight}}finance teams{{/highlight}} execute on xMatix
cardLayoutData.description: Financial execution runs on a shared operational layer, enabling finance teams to stay in sync with operations while maintaining governance and compliance.

features.title: Operational Event Capture
features.description: Capture financial-impacting events from sales, service, inventory, and payroll as they occur.

features.title: Policy-Driven Financial Controls
features.description: Apply approval rules, thresholds, and controls directly within execution workflows.

features.title: Continuous Reconciliation
features.description: Reconcile operational and financial data continuously, reducing month-end effort and errors.

features.title: Audit-Ready Closure
features.description: Close periods faster with complete traceability, governed adjustments, and real-time reporting.

requestADemo.heading: See how finance teams execute on xMatix
requestADemo.description: Request a demo to see how xMatix helps finance leaders improve accuracy, reduce leakage, and execute financial operations in lockstep with the business.
